zone.line: athwart frore vapours
Now dimly seen thro' tempests deep below,
Thro whose oer-shadowing woods I wandered once
With Asia, drinking life from her loved eyes,
Why scorns the spirit which informs ye, now
To commune with me--me alone, who checked--
As one who checks a fiend-drawn charioteer--
The falshood & the force of Him who reigns
Supreme, & with the groans of pining slaves
Fills your dim glens & liquid wildernesses?
Why answer ye not, still? brethren!
The Earth
They dare not
Prometheus
Who dares? for I would hear that curse again. . . .
Ha, what an awful whisper rises up!
'Tis scarce like sound, it tingles thro the frame
As lightning tingles, hovering ere it strike--
Speak Spirit! from thine inorganic voice
I only know that thou art moving near
And love. How cursed I him?
